fields.description:
After update from previous version first I get a NullReferenceException in SourceTree.View.FileLists.FileListViewManager and then KeyNotFoundException in MS.Internal.FontCache

Were my settings so wrong before?
fields.summary: Wow! New SourceTree is crashing a lot

fields.description:
Hi,

I've updated sourceTree this morning to the 1.8.2.2 version. And now, when I add a file in a repository, it is not shown in the working directory changes. 

It was not the case before, and I don't know whether it is a bug or not. But, I'd like to be able to see the new files in a repository whithout having to change the filter to "not followed files". 

Thanks,

Paul
fields.summary: New files not shown in "working directory"

fields.description:
When I open Tools -> Options, the window is bigger than my screen and I cannot see the window close button or the OK button. My screen is pretty average, not small. It's a business laptop, resolution 1600x900, DPI set to 125% on Windows 7.

It's possible that the issue manifests on other windows as well, but I haven't tested them all.
fields.summary: Options window bigger than screen

fields.description:
I changed font type of internal Diff to "MS Gothic", but it didn't work.
内蔵Diffのフォント種類を「MS Gothic」に変更したのですが、効果がありませんでした。

It seems just font size is available.
フォントの大きさだけは変えられるようです。

Thanks.
ご査収宜しくお願いいたします。
fields.summary: [Tool]-[Option]-[Diff]-[Change Font] won't work

fields.description: On 1st launch after upgrading sourcetree crashed with the attached error in the log. Subsequently, the application has launched without issue.
fields.summary: Crash on startup after upgrade

fields.description: We have a compiled css file which is quite large. When viewing the file for changes (which doesnt make sense, but the App does it automatically when clicking on the commit) in 1.7 the app did not crash but showed the changes (altough hard to read). In 1.8.2 the app simply crashes.
fields.summary: App crashes when viewing large files (already commited)

fields.description:
from update 1.8.2 
Every Korean character in diff panel is empty. 
 !image-2016-02-24-17-30-41-789.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Diff panel can't display unicode character

fields.description: http://f3.s.qip.ru/FaNZtywq.png
fields.summary: mercurial error
Crash on startup

fields.description: I was using the former version of SourceTree with a local git repository of my company. After installing the recent upgrade, SourceTree crashes on every startup, right after the program has finished loading.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes after update
Crash after update to 1.8.2.2 and login

fields.description:
Standalone. 
Installed 1.6.8 on a new machine and updated from there. Had multiple login failures to "my atlassian" before figuring out which password I needed to use. Then I got the "cant finf mecurial" message, and I chose "I don't want mecurial" (use git only). And finally - crash!
fields.summary: Crash after saying "I don't want to use mecurial" during setup.

fields.description:
*Updating from version 1.6.14.0 to 1.8.2.2*:
- I was asked to enter my Atlassian account info.
- entered incorrect username and password
- found my correct username, but entered in an incorrect password.
- was presented with a "Password has expired" prompt above the user and pass entry fields, _which I dismissed incorrectly as an "incorrect password" prompt._
- left dialog window open and opened web browser
-- looked up my correct password via my LastPass account
-- logged into my Bitbucket account with correct credentials and then noticed the same "Password has expired" prompt, this time noticing it for what it was.
-- updated my password via the web interface (Bitbucket site)
- returned to the SoureceTree installer.
- entered correct credentials and hit "Next" button
- it appeared to have accepted my credentials and was continuing to the next screen (I don't recall what it was, sorry)
- got the crash message and was encouraged to submit a bug

*Expected behavior*: SourceTree installer would continue after entering recently updated and valid Atlassian Account credentials
*Actual behavior*: After entering valid credentials which happened to be updated outside of the installer, it crashed.

attached:  [^2016-02-24 pete-goembel sourcetree.log]
fields.summary: Installer crash after Atlassian Account password entered

fields.description: I upgraded to 1.8.2 from 1.6.17 (which worked fine). Application crashes at start-up and prompts me to file this bug report. Log file attached.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on start up

fields.description:
As of v1.8 I am missing several context menus which you could have inside a open project. 
Before:
Context menu shows "Create new Branch"

Now:
Nothing

Before (context menu "Remote")
Create new remote

Now:
Nothing

I have to go via the Repository Menulink to find my option or lean yet another keybinding to do what I want.

Why is the useful context menu gone?
fields.summary: Multiple Context Menus are gone in 1.8

fields.description: After installing the latest version 1.8.2 I was welcomed with a setup wizard that that asked me to close my first Git repository. As a mistake I give it an folder that contained files and as expected an error saying "The fodler is not empty" popped. But that Error dialog is non closable, if I press the only button "OK" the dialog opened immediately again, the same happens if I press the close button of the dialog. Simply put it does not give me any option to change the folder and completely blocked the setup wizard. I had to kill the process and start over
fields.summary: Setting an non empty fodler when closing a repository for the first time open an "unclosable" Error dialog

fields.description: Since 1.8.x I can no longer multi-select and then drag and drop files in order to stage/unstage them. This used to work in all versions up to 1.7. Multi-select for diff view is still possible, but multi selection is lost when starting to DnD, only one file is left selected.
fields.summary: Can no longer stage multiple files via multi select + DnD since 1.8

fields.description: I've noticed the difference in font in only one file so far (vb text file).
fields.summary: SourceTree Diff window displays different fonts
Crash after Sourcetree upgrade

fields.description:
I can't set Mercurial in settings. Alert with 4 chooses (Download mercurial, mercurial folder, turnn od mercurial...) always showen...
can't open projects
fields.summary: After update Mercurial is not working

Please see screenshot.
Numbers are too close, diff is centered. Looks awful and unpolished. Especially compared to mac version which looks way better.

fields.description: *I hope the push dialog can be movable*
fields.summary: I hope the push dialog can be movable

hi, i have windows 10. when i opened sourcetree today it notified me of an available update. i downloaded and installed it, which went smooth. later while setting up, the application crashed.

attaching the log.

When file contains both changes in short and long lines, diff blocks are misaligned.

fields.description: When committing changes, selecting a file in the list of modified files no longer displays the changes in the diff view.  The diff view always shows the changes in the first file in the list.

fields.description: When committing files, the Select/Unselect All checkbox no longer works in version 1.8.0

thanks, 
Ben

Crash caused by missing git dir

fields.description: Add project bookmark sorting (alphabetical, last updated, etc.)  on the bookmark pane (left side of Source Tree Application).
fields.summary: Add sort options to Bookmark Pane

fields.description:
Include a search bar in the bookmark pane (left side of SourceTree Application) or on the upper right part of the application to easily search for cloned repositories on disk. 

Having more than 50 projects on your bookmark pane gives you a difficulty of searching for the project that you need to update (pull/push).
fields.summary: Provide Bookmark/Cloned Repository Search

fields.summary: Loss of context when right clicking a branch for action

fields.description:
Hi, I use sourcetree v1.8.2.0 
Data is displayed while Korean is broken  as shown attachment(error.png) after i updated it some days ago.
How do i fix this problem?
Thanks. have a nice day!.
fields.summary: data is displayed while Korean is broken.

fields.description:
Steps:
# Upgraded Sourcetree to 1.8.2
# Logged into Atlassian account
# Imported Github private key
# Selected "I don't want to use Mercurial"
# Crash

The crash log is attached.
fields.summary: Crash after upgrading to 1.8.2

fields.description:
Reproducible.

Select a commit, select a modified file on the Log / History tab, select a line in a hunk in the Diff pane, press CTRL+C.

The text is copied to the clipboard but SourceTree crashes after a second or so:
OpenClipboard Failed (Exception from HRESULT: 0x800401D0 (CLIPBRD_E_CANT_OPEN))

Log attached. Error and stack are identical each time.
fields.summary: Crash when CTRL+C in Diff Pane

fields.description:
It gets annoying when SourceTree plays the Exclamation chime when several different modals pop up. Most notably on the context menu for changed files in File Status view:

* Discard changes
* Remove file
* Stop tracking

There's already a modal dialog that guarantees my attention - the chimes while trying to work through a large set of files are unnecessary.

I didn't see any option to disable sounds to Tools > Options. Is that a possibility?
fields.summary: Disable Windows Exclamation sound on modal dialog popup

fields.description: See attached log file.
fields.summary: Crashed after installation and sign-in to JIRA account

fields.description: I'm not sure who decided to remove tree view as an option for the file listing, but this was a major feature for us due to the complexity of our project.  It says it was a performance deprecation, but I would think those who were having the performance problems could choose tnot to use it.  PLEASE ADD IT BACK IN.  I am wasting a lot of time looking for files again.
fields.summary: Put tree view back in place!

fields.description:
When viewing uncommited changes in both the 'File Status' tab and 'Log / History', and also having the 'Bookmarks' panel hidden, I am unable to resize the diff panel. There have been several Jiras about this in the past and it seems to have come back.

In order for me to resize the panel, I need to show the 'Bookmarks' panel. Interestingly enough, after hiding the 'Bookmarks' panel, I can continue to resize the diff panel. If all I do is show and then immediately hide the 'Bookmarks' panel, I cannot resize.

If I restart SourceTree, the problem is reset and I am unable to resize again.
fields.summary: Cannot resize diff panel for uncommited changes

fields.description:
If you have a local branch pointed at a remote branch that's had changes, you click the Pull button and check the "Rebase instead of Merge" box. If there's conflicts on the rebase that causes git to switch to a 3-way merge, instead of stopping and waiting to reconcile, it just blows up and goes back to the Pull dialog. You can right click and choose "retry Merge" and then attempt to resolve the conflict and continue the rebase, but it causes sourcetree to crash.

This worked perfectly fine in 1.7
fields.summary: Rebasing through Sourcetree fails on merge conflict

fields.description: Mercurial error. Either at installation or during startup. Mercurial accepts the offer download, download takes place, but again provides a dialog box asking to download / find Mercurial. Manually specify the path also fails. Before that there was a previous version of SourceTree
fields.summary: Mercurial error

fields.description: Sourcetree crashed during the upgrade process, after I had registered my existing account.
fields.summary: Crash during upgrade

fields.description: The new Source Tree user interface style is a faint grey smear on the monitors supplied by my work place. Please provide a method to have a higher contrast UI for those of us with poor monitors, impaired vision, or both.
fields.summary: New UI style is hard to use on screens with poor contrast

fields.description:
* Create a new file with lines of text with a blank newline at the end
* view the file in sourcetree
* the diff view is missing the last line of text

Note: this seems to impact past commits, not just new files
fields.summary: Diff view doesn't show the last line before the end of file

fields.description:
Ran the SourceTree 1.8.2 installer. Used it to launch SourceTree. Logged into my atlassian account (emailadres/password, not using G+), crashed.

Highly visible and thus Major, but not critical and certainly not a blocker as starting SourceTree "manually" (from Win10 start menu) worked fine.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed

fields.description:
Crashed after update to 1.8.2
I logged in with my Athlassian account.
fields.summary: Sourcetree or Windows crashed

fields.description: When I right-clicked and clicked "Push" on my subtree it crashed.  When I went back in to try again it worked.  A similar crash occurred when I upgraded and opened initially.  I upgraded a few hours ago.  So I'm hoping it was a one off.
fields.summary: Crash on Push to Subtree

fields.description:
This error appears as I attempt to finish the installation process of the latest version of SourceTree. When I am asked to log in, clicking the "Use an existing account" button attempts to load a login page through SourceTree. Unfortunately, SourceTree seems unable to load or properly execute all of the javascript on this page.
If I instead click "Go to My Atlassian," which sends me to this same page but in preferred webbrowser (Chrome), I have no issues whatsoever and the page loads/operates fine.

Closing out of SourceTree and starting it again allows me to reproduce the error, as I have yet to successfully login.
fields.summary: Error occurs running js through SourceTree while logging in

fields.description:
After installing the latest bits for 1.8.1 and 1.8.2 I get prompted to sign in. I was already signed in before upgrading but I am forced to log in again.
1) In the "Log in to your Atlassian Account" step in the Startup Wizard, click the "Use Existing Account" button.
2) Click on the "Login with Google" link.
3) Type in your user name
4) type in your password
Expected:
See the MFA prompt asking for the code sent to my phone.
Actual:
Redirected to the browser where I am supposed to start over.
fields.summary: Support MFA Google Logins

fields.description:
It used to be possible to select random files with control and just press space bar to get those files either staged or unstaged. Since version 1.8.0 it is no longer possible.

Usually, if it's just a few files or all is not a problem, but if you have to select through it's annoying to have to click on all the checkboxes.
fields.summary: Space bar no longer stage or unstage files

fields.description:
If i quickly go through a list of changes (using the keyboard down key)

{code}
The program SourceTree.exe version 1.8.2.0 stopped interacting with Windows and was closed. To see if more information about the problem is available, check the problem history in the Security and Maintenance control panel.
 Process ID: 543c
 Start Time: 01d16e794769ba93
 Termination Time: 17
 Application Path: C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe
 Report Id: 37f078ca-da6d-11e5-be37-a434d90f9f2d
 Faulting package full name: 
 Faulting package-relative application ID: 
{code}
fields.summary: Going quickly through a list of diffs hangs source tree

fields.description: Installed the new version. During install I was asked to connected to a public source repository. I instead clicked on the 'Skip This Step' button.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed
SourceTree crashes when I click on Terminal

fields.description:
Current behavior:
On the "file status" page, selecting one or more unstaged filed (via clicking the filename), then dragging to the staged files space, causes nothing to happen.

Previous behavior:  
selecting one or more unstaged files (via clicking the filename), then dragging to the staged files space, caused the files to be staged
fields.summary: Dragging file from "unstaged files" to "staged files" no longer has any effect.

fields.description:
Right-click on submodules. Open <SubmoduleName>...
*crash*
fields.summary: "Open Submodule" crash

fields.description: Update crashed after login and the question box "Do you want to upload an SSH Key".  I selected "No".  It then crashed, leaving Atlassian unusable.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashed while installing latest update

fields.description:
Copying multiple lines of SourceTree's diffs to the clipboard has always been possible using cmd-c. Here's a ticket showing that it was considered a pre-existing feature https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1564 (in comments).

Now, trying to copy multiple lines causes SourceTree to crash.  See attached log.
Source Tree 1.8.2

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1564
fields.summary: Crash: Copying multiple lines of diff to clipboard (Windows)
Crash when downloading Mercurial

fields.description:
Clean install of Windows 7, unable to get past the licence setup part of install.

1/ Install Sourctree onto clean Win7 64bit system that has chrome to handle all defaults.
2/ Setup licence page in install disobeys OS  Default Programs setting and opens Internet Explorer (!!)
3/ Log in via Google sign in.
4/ Phone beeps with 2FA code
5/ Chrome opens
6/ Invalid CSRF token found in form body  message

Nothing else...

Restart install, try the other licence path.  Log into MyAtlassian Account, download my sourcetree.license file.    There is no way to use this in the installer, and no way to go any further.

1/ Realize there is absolutely no quality control in the Sourcetree project
2/. Uninstall Sourcetree
3/ Download gitkraken and be free of the pain of yet another "quick it works, ship it" rushed out and botched Sourcetree release.
fields.summary: Totally unable to install Sourcetree 1.8.2 on clean system

fields.description:
During the upgrade I was forced to login to Atlassian.  I could not login via Google as we use an SSO to authenticate with our domain.  The page redirects in the google login failed.  Hard to explain..

I managed to login with my email and old password somehow :/
fields.summary: Cant login via Google when using SSO

fields.description: Every time a min.css file is viewed SourceTree immediately crashes.
fields.summary: Minified CSS crashes SourceTree 1.8.2

fields.description:
Creating this bug b/c I was prompted to do so by ST.

I ran the 1.8.2 installer and upon starting up SourceTree prompted me to sign in to Atlassian.  I clicked the Existing Account flow and signed in.  It had been a while since I signed in so I had to complete a password reset in a separate browser window.  Upon signing into My Atlassian back in SourceTree, it crashed and I got the prompt to create a bug.  SourceTree seems to be working fine upon reopening.
fields.summary: Just signed in after updating to 1.8.2.0 and ST crashed

fields.description:
When I went to commit some changes I noticed that the Select All Checkbox is not working

I have taken a screencast of it to show what I see

http://screencast.com/t/6w4tFItou5k7
fields.summary: Select All checkbox does nothing

fields.description:
!image-2016-02-23-10-28-30-068.png|thumbnail! 

The first line of the diff is rendering in a weird font. It might be because the diff affects the first line in the file, since I don't see the bug on my other files. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Diff renders in the wrong font in some cases

fields.description:
Log/History view shows number of changes behind but does not show the changes.

I have to do the pull before I can see the changes.
fields.summary: Log/History view shows number of changes behind but does not show the changes

fields.description:
SourceTree  does not go beyond the "Log in to your Atlassian account"

I've upgraded the latest version 1.8.2. After the upgrade, the application is opened and it stops after the first page which deals with the license agreement.  I've tried both buttons the "Go to My Atlassian" which opens my Atlassian account and shows the Source Tree license that was acquired when I first installed SourceTree.  I downloaded the license file as I thought that what was the installer was expecting so that it will be imported later.  The installer stayed on the same page.  Neither a dialog, nor the buttons changed to move forward with opening the application. 
Then I tried the other button "Use and existing account" and it took me to my account profile.  Still I couldn't move forward with opening the application.  

I clicked on the X on the top right corner to see if closing it, will open the application to import the license but it closes it.  Opening it again takes me to the first page "License Agreement".

As it is, the application cannot be used in Windows 7.  I don't know if this happens with upgrades but it is a serious defect.
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't pass beyond the Log in to your Atlassian account page

fields.description: Source tree freezes checkin subrepositories when committing.  There are no subrepos in the current project.  This has been sporadically happening since 1.5x
fields.summary: Sourcetree freezes when commiting with hg

fields.description:
Just installed 1.8.2. Previously installed version (1.6?) worked fine. Can no longer open any repo bookmarks. I dropped and re-added the bookmarks, but continue to get the same problem. See attached. Note that when I run git status from the command line, I get a correct response, showing me the status of the repo. Also attached. Additionally, other git gui tools seem to work just fine on this repo. I have 4 repos that I use on a regular basis, and ST cannot seem to open any of them, though the earlier version did just fine.

SourceTree is now completely unusable for me in any way.
fields.summary: Can't open any repo, "git status failed with code -1"

fields.description: I just installed the latest version 1.8.2. In the diff panel there are now these large regions of whitespace that is very visually unappealing. Previously the green and red bands would extend the full width of the application. Please restore the previous behavior.
fields.summary: Improper use of whitespace on diff panels

fields.description:
After update source tree to the last version it asked if I want to download mercurial, i agreed, after that ST asked me again and again about it. On the third time i said that i dont want to load it and ST crashed.
Log attached
fields.summary: AppCrash after several attemps to load mercurial

fields.description: When double clicking on the Branches or Tags in the tree list view for a particular repository, the expected functionality would be to expand the tree. Instead, it attempts to checkout the Branches branch or the Tags branch, which don't exist.
fields.summary: Double clicking on Branches or Tags should not initiate a checkout.

fields.description:
since the new (UI) version I cannot sort tabs anymore!

please add it again!
fields.summary: Sort tabs

fields.description: When the new version was installing it required a entering all my credentials again. I did not expect that. I had forgotten my password, so I had to look for it, and eventually reset it. This disturbed my work process unnecessarily.
fields.summary: Update to new version of SourceTree logs you out without warning

fields.description: Run merge tool on a conflicted file.  (I'm using p4merge).  Save file, exit merge tool, then when getting back to SourceTree, SourceTree crashes.

fields.description: After logging into my Atlassian account during installation (and clicking past script errors), I clicked Skip Setup, then promptly crashed.

fields.description:
On Sourcetree for windows has disappared the "Show file in explorer" menu, is it possible to have it back?

Please......
fields.summary: Show file in explorer

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

1. Modify a file by adding two lines (line A, line B)
2. Stage single line only (e.g. line A)
(By now the modified file is still selected in unstaged panel, diff showing remaining changes available to be staged)
3. Select the same file in staged by clicking it
(Diff panel is blank, it should show line A as staged change instead)

When i click the staged file again second time, line A diff now displays correctly.
Then, when i click to select the unstaged file again, the diff view for line B is blank again

This happens to hunks too.
fields.summary: Diff panel is blank when staging only part of a file

fields.description:
Checkbox on *FIle Status tab* that checks\unchecks all pending files is not working ( it is not working for changed subprepos too ). It looks like it doesnt work at all.
See attach. Playing with that that checked checkbox does nothing

PS:
This occurred after merging another branch into my one.
OR
When i'm trying to up repo that contains modified subrepos.

PS:
After clicking similar checkbox on *Log/History tab* - one on File Status tab is fixed.
fields.summary: Select all files to commit all of them is not working

fields.description: When staging files for commit/other actions, each time a new file is checked to stage or unstage it, the screen flashes dark for a fraction of a second.  It looks like there's some kind of popup or status message showing up and darkening the rest of the sourcetree window briefly. Jarring experience. Just came up with 1.8.2 update.
fields.summary: Screen flashes when staging files

fields.description:
In order to manage the permissions on the various repository and build a coherent application, we use submodules. With SourceTree we never have been able to properly manage the main repository because we do not have the permissions to all the repository so when we push the main repository, the push fails.

This is very annoying. 

To bypass the problem, we use SourceTree to do git manipulation on the submodules but not on the main repository.

For the main repository, we use the command lines with the following codes.
// Script used to push
{code}
#!/bin/sh
# Stage everything.
git add -A

# Check is something need to be commited.
if git diff --cached --exit-code &> /dev/null; then
  echo -e "\nNothing to commit"
else
  # Working directory (RDE).
  wd=$(pwd)

  # Clear .msg file.
  > .msg

  # Fill .msg with commit messages from submodules.
  echo -e "\nGathering commit messages...\n"

  git submodule foreach --quiet "git log --pretty=format:'%s %n%n' origin/master..master >> '$wd/.msg'"

  # Store the content of .msg in a variable and delete the file.
  msg=$(cat .msg)
  rm .msg

  git commit --allow-empty -m "$msg"
fi

git push origin master --recurse-submodules=on-demand

{code}

// Script used to pull
{code}
#!/bin/sh

# If true, update submodules even if RDE is up to date.
force_update=false

# Parse parameters.
while getopts ":f" opt; do
  case $opt in
    f)
      echo -e "\nForce submodule update!\n" >&2
      force_update=true
      ;;
    \?)
      echo -e "\nInvalid option: -$OPTARG\n" >&2
      exit
      ;;
  esac
done

git fetch origin --recurse-submodules=on-demand && git fetch origin --tags

state=$(git rebase origin/master)

if ([ $? -eq 0 ] && [ "$state" != "Current branch master is up to date." ]) || [ "$force_update" = true ]; then
	git submodule update && git submodule foreach "git --no-pager log --pretty=format:'%C(yellow)%h%Creset %s %C(cyan)<%an>%Creset' master..HEAD && git rebase HEAD master"
	git status
else
	echo $state;
fi
{code}

*Note: we do not initialize all the submodules otherwise when we update we get conflicts if we do not have any rights to the repository*
fields.summary: Submodule management

fields.description:
Updated SourceTree today and now I can't use it. First I created a Atlassian account and then it fails to login.

1. Created account by clicking "Go to My Atlassian" and "Login with google".
2. Went back to SourceTree and clicked "Use an existing account" -> "Login with google" (goes to browser -> select google account).
3. Ended up with this message: "Invalid CSRF token found in form body" on this page: "https://id.atlassian.com/login/google?application=sourcetree".

Second try:
1. Also tried "Go to MyAtlassian" and create a new account normally (but with the same email registered to my "Login with Google" account). They seem to have merged since I could create the account with the same email.
2. Tried "Use an existing account" and login with the email and password to that account but it just fails saying email or pw is wrong.

Reinstall of SourceTree does not work.
fields.summary: Unable to login and start sourcetree after update

fields.description:
We have multiple users logged onto the same windows server and attempt to use Source Tree, most of the functionality works for each user. We've had 2 significant issues

# Using bitbucket, and clicking on the clone in source tree button which opens an application link directly to source tree seems to go to the wrong users. We will click the button and the logon prompt will open for a separate user on our windows box. 
# We're not sure if this is linked with above, but we have seen repository's that we have already authed for prompt us for re-logon with another users email pre-filled in. 

We can't update to the 1.8 at this moment (Will as soon as possible), but from the release notes I'm not sure this was addressed
fields.summary: Allowing Multi User Usage at the same time (Windows Server) -

fields.description:
I installed update. Then it required full reinitialization as if I installed the app from the scratch. It's not very user friendly.
But what's worth is that it finally crashed with NPE.
Log with stack trace is attached.
fields.summary: Crash on the start just after update

fields.description: My interns use shared computers, but log on with separate accounts. After updating to ST for Win 1.8.0, their bookmarks are being shared across user accounts. The result is that when one user opens up SourceTree for the day, it picks up where the last user left off, pointing to his/her most recent repository in his/her C:\Users\ folder.
fields.summary: Multiple Accounts Share Bookmarks list

fields.description: After the upgrade to version 1.8.0.36401 fix conflicts via External Tool -Tortise Git doesn't work now. When I am trying to do it I see the error window which offers to choose close the Source Tree , use debbug program or find a solution on the Internet (classic error window).
fields.summary: Fix conflicts via External Tool (Tortise Git) doesn't work

fields.description: Lines with UTF8 characters are broken in diff view. See attached screenshot for details.
fields.summary: UTF8 characters break diff view.

fields.description: Sourctree used to have a feature to stage and unstage individual lines on a git repository. This seems to be no longer possible. I'm not sure wether this affects only 1.8.2 or started at 1.8.0, but I'm sure the versions prior to 1.8.0 are not affected.
fields.summary: Per-line-staging missing in Sourcetree 1.8.2

fields.description:
When a new file is added to a repo and viewed in the "Working Copy" area (staged or unstaged) if you click on any line in the diff in the right pane, the scroll bar jumps down.

For instance, if you click on line 11 it will jump down so the header that has the filename (that would otherwise have the "stage lines/hunk" buttons) and the heading "File Contents" is off the screen and line 1 is at the very top of the pane. If you have a line selected and click in the diff it will cause there to be a double-selection. For instance, if you have line 1 selected and click to select line 6, the scroll will jump down and now lines 6 and 11 will be selected.

After this jump has happened, you can click anywhere in the diff and it behaves as expected until you scroll to the top again, at which point the odd behavior is again present.
fields.summary: Embedded diff scroll jumps when clicking any line of new file

fields.description: I was following the update release wizard. I skiped the test to link to a Git account, and then it crashed.
fields.summary: Crash when Updating to latest release on feb 23

fields.description: If the user double-clicks on the "Branches" or "Tags" category headings, Source Tree will attempt to checkout "Branches" or "Tags" (which likely won't exist).
fields.summary: "Branches" and "Tags" category headings are treated as Branches
